member.name: T:UnitsNet.Temperature
member.summary: A temperature is a numerical measure of hot or cold. Its measurement is by detection of heat radiation or particle velocity or kinetic energy, or by the bulk behavior of a thermometric material. It may be calibrated in any of various temperature scales, Celsius, Fahrenheit, Kelvin, etc. The fundamental physical definition of temperature is provided by thermodynamics.

member.name: M:UnitsNet.Temperature.GetValueInBaseUnit

member.returns: The value in the base unit representation.
